description: Generalized Collatz sequences: primes resulting in a cycle containing 1.
comments: For each prime P check the generalized Collatz sequence of each integer N > 1 defined by c(1) = N, c(n+1) = c(n) * P + 1 if F > P, else c(n+1) = c(n) / F, where F is the smallest factor of c(n), until c(n) = c(m) for n > m starts a cycle. If all c(i) > 1, then P does not belong to the sequence (and vice versa).All terms are as yet only conjectures. _Jeff Heleen_ checked the primes < 1000 and start points up to 10000000 (see Prime Puzzle 114 and example below). a(1)=3 is the ordinary Collatz problem. - Frank Ellermann, Jan 20 2002.
